etymology.description: Pictogram of a ritual (jade) axe kept near the throne for ceremonies; symbol of royal power.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a ceremonial axe used in royal rites, a concrete emblem of sovereign authority. A later folk reading treats the three horizontals as Heaven–Man–Earth joined by the vertical, and it is unrelated to 玉 or 主.

examples.chinese: 国王召见大臣(國王召見大臣)。
在古代，王举行祭祀以祈福(在古代，王舉行祭祀以祈福)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gǔdài, wáng jǔxíng jìsì yǐ qífú.
examples.english: In ancient times, the king performed rituals to pray for blessings.
